title.narrative: (903.3) CHILDREN'S RIGHT TO ACCESSING JUSTICE

description.narrative: CHILDREN'S RIGHT TO ACCESSING JUSTICE - Equitable children's access to justice further promoted and evidence on the realization of rights of children beyond child protection enhanced., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Partners supported to provide supportive and caring environment for all children, especially the most vulnerable, focusing on prevention measures

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: CHILDREN?S RIGHT TO ACCESSING JUSTICE - Equitable children?s access to justice further promoted and evidence on the realization ofrights of children beyond child protection enhanced.

description.narrative: Engagement with and support to country offices on the justice for children’s work continued through the year. Particular focus was on enhancing diversion and alternatives to custody measures in countries still having many children in pre- and post-trial detention. The impact assessment of Covid19 States measures on children’s rights was completed. Findings draw attention to the adverse effects of the measures on the rights of children in all countries that participated. The finalised COP whitepaper and the Western Balkans justice for children paper are important instruments for engagement with EU and other partners on these work streams. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/03/2022
